## PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 298, 301, 314]]<|/det|>
Paper 4 Theory (Extended)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 338, 415, 354]]<|/det|>
Candidates answer on the Question Paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 359, 366, 374]]<|/det|>
No Additional Materials are required.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 390, 388, 407]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 416, 715, 431]]<|/det|>
Write your centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 431, 320, 446]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 446, 504, 461]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 460, 504, 475]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 475, 380, 490]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 501, 255, 515]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 515, 361, 530]]<|/det|>
Electronic calculators may be used.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 530, 767, 560]]<|/det|>
You may lose marks if you do not show your working or if you do not use appropriate units. Take the weight of \(1.0\mathrm{kg}\) to be \(10\mathrm{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 10\mathrm{m / s}^2\) ).  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 570, 604, 585]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 584, 757, 600]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
Fig. 2.1 is the top view of a small ship of mass \(1.2 \times 10^{6} \text{kg}\). The ship is moving slowly sideways at \(0.040 \text{m/s}\) as it comes in to dock.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[133, 112, 863, 365]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 380, 532, 399]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 2.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 411, 670, 429]]<|/det|>
The ship hits the wooden pillars which move towards the dock wall.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 443, 144, 462]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 441, 672, 460]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[448, 549, 922, 568]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 611, 645, 630]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[522, 797, 920, 816]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 144, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 71, 858, 89]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[494, 227, 920, 244]]<|/det|>

Every reasonable effort has been made by the publisher (UCLES) to trace copyright holders, but if any items requiring clearance have unwittingly been included, the publisher will be pleased to make amends at the earliest possible opportunity.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 872, 920, 907]]<|/det|>
To avoid the issue of disclosure of answer-related information to candidates, all copyright acknowledgements are reproduced online in the Cambridge Assessment International Education Copyright Acknowledgements Booklet. This is produced for each series of examinations and is freely available to download at www.cambridgeinternational.org after the live examination series.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 916, 920, 940]]<|/det|>
Cambridge Assessment International Education is part of the Cambridge Assessment Group. Cambridge Assessment is the brand name of the University of Cambridge Local Examinations Syndicate (UCLES), which itself is a department of the University of Cambridge.
